User provide high-level research directi.Format: Natural language problem statements, user needs, design challenges
User provide high-level research directi.Example: Product for segregation as a means for effective waste management; Product for footwear disinfection and cleaning for improved hygiene and safety.
User provide high-level research directi.Role in workflow: Defines the design problem and sets the scope for ideation by the CAI system.

User provide structured, domain-specific.Format: Structured prompts with essential fields (e.g., activity, item, contradiction, constraint, criteria)
User provide structured, domain-specific.Example: AI3C: Activity-Item-Contradiction-Constraint-Criteria model for problem statement structuring.
User provide structured, domain-specific.Role in workflow: Guides the CAI to generate relevant and context-specific ideas.

User provide representations or formal i.Format: Structured prompts and problem statements; selection of ideation stage and prompt type via interface
User provide representations or formal i.Example: Designer fills in essential fields in a pop-up window, which auto-populates the input message in a structured format.
User provide representations or formal i.Role in workflow: Ensures the CAI receives actionable, well-structured queries for idea generation.

Query Decomposition.Method details: Problem statements are decomposed into structured fields (activity, item, contradiction, constraint, criteria) using the AI3C model.
Query Decomposition.Inputs: User-provided unstructured user needs or problem descriptions.
Query Decomposition.Outputs: Structured problem statements for CAI input.
Query Decomposition.Example: Populating AI3C fields for a water purification device problem.
Query Decomposition.Role in workflow: Transforms vague user needs into actionable, structured prompts for the CAI.

Idea/hypothesis generation without addit.Method details: A fine-tuned GPT-4 model generates design ideas based on structured prompts and problem statements, using its internal knowledge.
Idea/hypothesis generation without addit.Inputs: Structured prompts (AI3C, AOC, PFIC models), user-provided problem statements.
Idea/hypothesis generation without addit.Outputs: Textual statements of design ideas and concepts.
Idea/hypothesis generation without addit.Example: CAI generates ideas for a portable water purification device based on user-structured input.
Idea/hypothesis generation without addit.Role in workflow: Produces a large, diverse set of novel ideas for product design.

Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Method details: GPT-4 is fine-tuned with domain-specific design knowledge and acts as an expert designer in ideation.
Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Example: GPT-4 generates ideas for waste management or footwear cleaning as an expert designer.
Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Role in workflow: Ensures generated ideas are relevant to the specific design domain.

Idea/hypothesis generation after Fine-Tu.Method details: GPT-4 is fine-tuned on product design-related documents, books, and articles to enhance ideation capabilities.
Idea/hypothesis generation after Fine-Tu.Example: Fine-tuned GPT-4 generates more relevant and creative design ideas.
Idea/hypothesis generation after Fine-Tu.Role in workflow: Improves the quality and relevance of generated ideas.

Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Human/Exp.Method details: Expert evaluators (design researchers) assess the novelty, variety, and meaningfulness of ideas generated by CAI and traditional methods.
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Human/Exp.Inputs: Sets of ideas generated by CAI and human designers.
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Human/Exp.Outputs: Expert ratings (Likert scale) for novelty, variety, and meaningfulness.
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Human/Exp.Example: 80 experts rate ideas for novelty and variety; 20 experts compare pairs for meaningfulness.
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Human/Exp.Role in workflow: Validates and prioritizes generated ideas based on expert judgment.
